climbs.name: Goliath
climbs.fa: K. Reynolds, S. Stevenson, C. Scales

content.description:
Starts up a mostly fingers crack to a roof. Pull the roof on a good knob and an okay pinch to a strenuous lieback/undercling. A big move brings you to better holds and 10-12 feet of easy climbing to a 2 bolt anchor shared with:

British Invasion

and

Eagle's Traverse

.
content.protection: Heavy on smaller pieces. There are 2 fixed pins. The first looks pretty good. The second doesn't seem to be driven very far into the crack, so I would recommend girth hitching it close to the rock (fun on lead) rather than clipping the eye.

content.description:
Start in the open book and climb up under the roof. Traverse right in a good crack, and meet up with the vertical handcrack that leads to the 2 bolt anchor shared with:

British Invasion

and

Goliath

.
content.protection: A standard rack with extra hand-sized pieces.

content.description: This is an obvious crack with a little pinnacle in front of the start. Layback and jam to a rest ledge before the crux of laybacks and jams that traverses left to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Lots of cams: 0.4-4 and doubles of 0.5-2. You can place nuts and smaller cams as well. This thing takes as much gear as you can carry up.
content.location:
It is about 15' right of

Goliath

.

content.description:
Begin climbing a thin crack with flaring finger pods. After reaching a sloping horizontal-ish crack, move right on fantastic thin face moves clipping 2 bolts. A nice right diagonal signals the end of the hard climbing. Keep moving straight up to a hand crack and finish on the 2 bolt anchor.

This is a tad runout to the hand crack unless you have a blue/green offset Alien or equivalent size, it is not too bad though.
